transcript: ‚Äâ Prime Day might be the apex of summer sales, but it has also inspired plenty of other vendors to create alternative sales to shop, should Amazon not have everything you need. Sephora, DSW, Nordstrom Rack and Wayfair are just a few names getting in on the discounts, with prices slashed on everything from must-have shoes for summer to that patio furniture you've been eyeing. While some stores like Walmart are waiting to kick off these sales, plenty already have loads of deals on helpful and fun items that will elevate your summer. Keep reading to shop, and check back as we add more sales to this list! By clicking on these shopping links, visitors will leave ABCNews.com and Goodmorningamerica.com, and these e-commerce sites are operated under different terms and privacy policies. ABC will receive a commission for purchases made through these links. SOME PRICES ARE DYNAMIC AND MAY CHANGE FROM THE DATE OF PUBLICATION. Have questions about ordering or a purchase? Click here. Walmart will host its Walmart Deals event July 8-13, with discounts on everything from tech to fashion throughout the store and online. One notable place to save is with early back-to-school savings on supplies for students, while upgraded pickup, delivery and app experiences will make shopping easier than ever. Among the brands you can expect to see discounted are Samsung, Vizio, Dyson, Sharpie and many more. And if you're looking for early access to these sales, sign up to become Walmart+ member and shop these deals and more a full night early. Clearance styles, for example, are an additional 10% off with promo code LASTCHANCE, while in-store clearance items will reflect an additional 40% discount. Select Adidas, Nike, Crocs and Reef styles are up to 25% off, while other new styles are arriving at up to half off. Adidas VL Court 3.0 Sneaker - Women's Crocs Getaway Platform Sandal Wayfair's July 4 deals are in full swing, with deals up to 70% off on outdoor furniture, dishwashers, area rugs and more. French Door Refrigerator with Elevated Deli Drawer - Fingerprint Resistant Stainless Steel You can save up to 75% when you use promotional code JULY4 at NYDJ's outlet sale. Everything from the brand's popular Marilyn jean to sleeveless blouses that make it easy to look put together in the heat are included in the markdowns. transcript: ‚Äâ Beauty fans wanting to stock up on premium anti-ageing products for less can snap up a Rodial skincare set on LookFantastic. TheRodial Dragon's Blood Little Luxuries Kit offers a four-step routine for firmer and brighter skin - and it's currently on 48% off. Reduced from ¬£106 to ¬£55 and featuring the skincare's iconic Dragon's Blood range, the Little Luxuries Kit is designed to hydrate, plump and soothe, for a dewy complexion. Shoppers can get a full-size 100ml Dragon's Blood Cleansing Water, and deluxe sizes of the Sculpting Gel, Eye Gel and Velvet Cream. For those who are not familiar with the active ingredient, Dragon's Blood is a tree sap that contains blood-like pigments and is collected from Dragon trees found on the coast of Yemen. It has anti-inflammatory properties, helping with hydration, calming irritation, and potentially reducing breakouts. Among the set, shoppers will find the Dragon's Blood Sculpting Gel, which costs ¬£95 for a full size, it's a firming serum blended with actives including Collageneer and Volufiline to improve the elasticity and firmness in the complexion, leaving it more toned and plumped. Scoring a 4.8 star based on 158 reviews, shoppers said it boosted skin hydration and skin elasticity. One shared: "My skin is at its best it has been since menopause wrecked it." "Being 50+ I needed all the help I could regarding plumpness for my face," a second chimed in. "I have tried many high end products and can honestly say that this is the first one I truly thought I can see and feel a big difference." Some people found the Sculpting Gel performing average with no visible difference after using it, but one said it made her skin look "10 years younger". Other than Rodial, their sister brand Nip+Fab also offer a Dragon's Blood Fix Plumping Serum at a more affordable price and it's now reduced to ¬£14.39 on Amazon. Shoppers can also visit Debenhams for the skinChemists Youth Series Sensitive Serum Dragon's Blood 5% 30ml x 2 Duo Pack, which has been marked down with 52% and dropped to ¬£21.90. The lightweight, fast-absorbing formula hydrates the skin for a radiant glow, making it ideal for both day and night use. What's inside theRodial Dragon's Blood Little Luxuries Kit: Dragon's Blood Cleansing Water 100ml Dragon's Blood Sculpting Gel 9ml Dragon's Blood Eye Gel 5ml Dragon's Blood Velvet Cream 10ml READ NEXT: Best birthday gifts for men in 2025 from watches to smoothie makers Nadine Baggott 'swears by' ¬£18 deodorant with over 13,000 reviews on Amazon Roman's 'comfortable and cool' summer dress hailed 'perfect' for hiding upper arms Charlotte Tilbury's new blush sticks deliver a 'dreamy' summer glow without the sun LookFantastic launch Kiko Milano edit with seven full-size products worth ¬£90

transcript: ‚Äâ 1. An absolutely genius device called a "Supoon" ‚Äî this perfectly sized spoon not only helps you scrape every last bit of food from the container (think: peanut butter, yogurt, cream cheese, etc.) but also has a unique design that keeps it away from the countertop when you set it down! This is about to prevent SO many "babe, stop leaving your peanut butter spoon on the counter" arguments. Natalie Brown / BuzzFeed "When I impulse-bought this mini spatula (called a "supoon") at the grocery store a few years ago, I knew it was good, but not THIS good. See that little dip in the neck? That means you can set it down on the counter and whatever's on it won't end up touching said counter. Here's a few of the many things I use this dishwasher-safe beauty for ‚Äî and yep, it makes it into basically every dishwasher load, I use it THAT frequently. - Scraping every last bit of sauce, curry, salad dressing, or soup out of takeout or leftover containers, like in the picture above. This happens several times a week. I want every bit of all that flavor!! - Measuring out a few teaspoons of water when re-steaming takeout rice in the microwave. - Scraping out yogurt, hummus, salsa, hot sauce, peanut butter, expensive Bonne Maman jams, etc., etc., when I'm down to the last little bit of each. (It's too big for most beauty products, but that's fine.) - Mixing together a quick stir-fry sauce in a measuring cup, then scraping that sauce out of the cup into the pan, all with a single utensil. - Scrambling together a mixture of eggs and whatever else I want in a bowl and scraping all of that into a pan. - Scooping pancake batter my MIL sent over into a pan to make my 9-month-old fresh pancakes, including scraping the last bits out to get as much pancake as possible. Like, I know I functioned in the kitchen before I had this, but this saves me so much time scraping over and over with a spoon. And that price! A no-brainer. " ‚Äî Natalie Brown Get it from Amazon for $6.99 , and find more sizes and colors on the Dreamfarm Amazon Store Page . 2. Miss Mouth's Messy Eater Stain Treater Spray , which is so effective that you'll remain suspiciously calm the next time your tot's chocolate milk makes its way from their sippy cup to the couch cushion. Or when your glass of merlot faces a similar fate. Just spray, blot, rinse, and pour another. Heather Braga/BuzzFeed " My 1-year-old is a big ice pop fan, so I've got a long life ahead of me to be filled with stain removal. In the above photo I held her while she sucked down a red ice pop on a 90 degree day. Naturally, it dripped all over my white tank top (note to self: stop wearing white around these kids). I was actually kind of excited because it meant I got to put my newly purchased bottle of Miss Mouth's Messy Eater Stain Treater Spray to the test! I followed the directions on the bottle that said to dampen the stained area, spray it with the stain remover, then pop it into the washing machine as usual. What do ya know ‚Äî it really worked! Completely cleared away all the red stains! Not sure what witchcraft has been used to make this product, but I'm here for it." ‚Äî Heather Braga Promising review: "My 1-year-old has taco meat stains ALL over the sleeves of his shirt. The stains were 2‚Äì3 days old, too. I sprayed the shirt, let it sit for about 15 minutes, and then washed the shirt with regular laundry soap. Almost every bit of the stains came out. Definitely buying bulk in this product!" ‚Äî Sloan Avery Get it from Amazon for $7.97 (available in three sizes and multipacks). 3. A Ninja Swirl machine that makes soft serve ice cream at the touch of a button, which is truly the future Spy Kids promised us. You can also use it to whip up frozen yogurt, frozen custard, sorbet, milkshakes, and scooped ice cream. Heather Braga / BuzzFeed "I have this machine and can assure you it is actually worth every penny. IDK about you, but where I live in New York, it's gotten VERY expensive to go out for ice cream (or buy it to bring home). Now that I have a family of four, it just makes more sense to find a way to make our favorite flavors at home. Setting the Ninja Swirl up was very simple; the "hardest" part is just remembering to freeze the "base" of your ice creams ahead of time so they're ready to be "spun" when you want to eat them. I've seen all over TikTok how people 'meal prep' their ice creams for the week and just pop 'em in the freezer (incredible). Anyways, the soft serve feature is incredible!...

transcript: ‚Äâ Summer fashion is on the menu, and while high-street favourites such as New Look and H&M have some great options available right now, one dress from Roman has caught our attention. The floral maxi dress, which is just ¬£48, is part of Roman's summer collection and would be perfect for park picnics or days out at the beach. And, right now, shoppers can save an extra 10% using the code HAPPY. The dress boasts short sleeves, offering some coverage, an attention-grabbing shirred waist, and a tassel tie detail. There's even a modest slit in the skirt for that extra bit of breeziness, reports Nottingham Post. When it comes to accessorising, the options are endless. Dress it up with sparkling heels and gold trinkets for formal occasions, or pair it with ballet flats and standout sunglasses for casual garden get-togethers. The dress comes in a selection of different patterns, too, including various floral prints and an on-trend polka dot print. The dress comes in sizes 10 to 20. However, several sizes are already sold out in some of the patterns. If your size isn't available, Phase Eight also offers a fantastic range, including this floral maxi dress (¬£109, originally ¬£189) with long sleeves for a similar feel to the Roman dress. For something different yet equally enchanting, Joe Browns showcases a stunning floral knee-length number (¬£48), available in both petite and regular sizes. It's designed to highlight the waist and features a delightful V-neckline. Customers have been heaping praise on the Roman Originals light blue dress, with one satisfied buyer exclaiming: "It's a lovely colour, and the material keeps you cool in this hot weather." Another happy shopper shared their enthusiasm: "I love this dress. It fits my size 16, hangs nicely, and looks good with my trainers." One more pleased customer couldn't hide their delight: "I just love this dress - I feel amazing in it. When you are a larger person, as I am, it isn't easy to find something you like. The dress flows and gives me a nicer shape. Everyone thought I looked amazing and that I had lost some weight." Yet, not all reviews were positive, with a dissatisfied customer stating: "I loved this dress but was very disappointed with the length. It was far too long." On the other hand, another contented patron praised their find: "(The dress is) beautiful, a wonderful fit, and a perfect length. I'm 5'7". When you put on the dress, you feel amazing. It's a dress that can be worn for any occasion. ". transcript: ‚Äâ Retailers are stepping up with well-timed promotions to capture consumer interest and minimize the impact of next week's powerhouse Amazon Prime Days event. Beauty shoppers now have more ways than ever online and off to score deals and experiences, and timing is anything but coincidental. Here's how retailers are turning up the heat this July: SEPHORA x Lyft (July 7-10) With a tagline like ‚ÄúGet Beauty from People Who Get Beauty‚Äù, Sephora is stepping up and leaning into its in-store associate expertise. Free rides (up to $20) to stores in NYC, LA, SF, Chicago and Seattle combined with in-store perks including skin scans, samples and $10 off purchases over $50, hope to lure shoppers in for expert advice and immersive experiences. Ulta Beauty Summer Sale (July 7-13) Offering up to 40% off top brands like Tarte, Urban Decay and Redken with bonus loyalty points drive both online and in-store traffic. Nordstrom Anniversary Sale Early Access (starts July 9) Beauty exclusives from La Mer, Charlotte Tilbury and MAC Free GWPs and deluxe samples incentivize in-person visits. Walmart Deals (July 8-13) Part of its broader Prime Day alternative event, Walmart will offer budget-friendly beauty essentials and big-name brands at lowered prices, boosting convenience for cost-conscious and deal-focused shoppers. Target Circle Week (July 6-12) Exclusive beauty discounts for members and same-day delivery bonuses perfectly timed to rival Prime Day. With these special promotions and others, shoppers are sure to see major beauty deals, enjoy in-store experiences, and earn rewards by shopping smart across multiple retailers. Curious where are you planning to shop next week? ‚¨á

transcript: ‚Äâ From drugstore staples to K-beauty saviors. Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy. Some shocking news: toners aren't all that necessary. Still, that doesn't mean they're not a good supplementary treatment to have in your skincare regimen, especially if you have chronically dry, dehydrated skin. Since toners are an optional step, if you do choose to use a toner, it should at least check off a few boxes, but one, in particular, is of the most importance: hydration. But what is a toner, anyway? ‚ÄúA toner is a solution that typically contains actives and is designed to be used after cleansing and before moisturizing. Toners can balance pH, remove impurities, exfoliate, and hydrate. They are not necessary, but they can provide great benefits,‚Äù says Dr. Blair Murphy-Rose, a board-certified dermatologist at Laser & Skin Surgery Center of New York and clinical instructor of dermatology at Weill Cornell Medical College. For those with dry skin, ‚Äúthe benefits of a toner depend on the specific formulation and the ingredients it contains. Many toners contain exfoliating actives that help to improve tone and texture, reduce dullness, diminish hyperpigmentation, and bring a glow to the skin,‚Äù she adds. Toners made specifically for dry skin can ‚Äúhydrate, balance pH, and remove residual oils.‚Äù Best Calming Toner ANUA Heartleaf 77 Soothing Toner Read more Best Toner for Beginners CeraVe Hydrating Toner Read more Best for Gentle Exfoliation Paula's Choice Skin Perfecting 6% Mandelic Acid + 2% Lactic Acid Liquid Exfoliant Read more While your TikTok and Instagram bookmark tab is likely chock-full of toners on your wishlist, we did the hard work for you by combing through dozens of online customer reviews and our personal stash to find the 12 best toners for dry skin. We also polled Dr. Murphy-Rose for her tips and derm-approved picks. Supple skin is on its way! 1Best Calming Toner ANUA Heartleaf 77 Soothing Toner Now 14% Off Pros Cools stressed skin Cons May not be best for super sensitive skin Key ingredients: Heartleaf extract, Size: 8.45 fl oz Perfect for sensitive skin, this toner feels like a spa retreat for stressed, irritated skin. Heartleaf extract is the star of the show, providing calming and anti-inflammatory properties to prep your skin for subsequent steps. It's also super hydrating and helps restore the skin's barrier. Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars An ELLE editor says: ‚ÄúNot going to lie, TikTok put this toner on my radar. It seems as if I'm prone to stress, and my skin is the first place my worries rear its head, but this toner has helped calm my skin down at its worst times. After cleansing (with the Quercetinol Cleanser, of course), this toner seeps into my skin and leaves it feeling refreshed and soothed.‚Äù ‚ÄîNerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor 2Best Toner for Beginners CeraVe Hydrating Toner Pros Soothing and hydrating ingredients Cons Some reviewers reported stickiness Key ingredients: hyaluronic acid, niacinamide, ceramides Size: 6.8 oz...

transcript: ‚Äâ sm is supported by our readers. When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Sign up for our free weekly newsletter for hot deals, best buys and expert reviews I would like to be emailed about offers, event and updates from Evening Standard. Read our privacy notice. With a full-time job, busy social life, and social media to update, it's challenging to keep up with all the newness out there. So, we've created The Shopping Shortlist: a monthly need-to-know dispatch of the latest and greatest releases that should be on your radar for the month ahead. Here at ES Best, we've got our ears to the ground and our noses pressed up against the digital shop fronts, always looking for the latest fashion, events, and food and drink - so you don't have to. From sell-out collections to limited edition collaborations, with exclusive events, fresh launches and new store unveilings in between, we've got you covered so you don't miss out on a thing. July's biggest shopping news is the return of Amazon's flagship sale: Prime Day. The fun and games (not to mention those mega discounts we've come to anticipate yearly) will kick off on July 8 - 11, which means there are four whole days to take advantage of those exclusive deals. There will be thousands of offers flying around, but if you're looking for a shortcut to the best of them, stay tuned to Standard Shopping where we will have curated guides on everything from clothes and Chromebooks to Kindles and mobile phones. Wimbledon has also kicked off this month, thrilling audiences with on-court action. Whether you've got a hot ticket to centre court or you're planning a watch party picnic, we've got the essentials you need to ace it. And, of course, there's the usual smorgasbord of glittering new launches, exciting collabs and epic shopping drops that will make this July shine. If you're ever at a loss for something to do on the weekend or want to scratch the retail therapy itch, we'll keep this page updated throughout the month; best to bookmark it so you've always got the insider's guide at your fingertips. Don't forget to sign up for the newsletter version of this Shortlist for a weekly digest covering everything from fashion and furniture to tech and travel. Ready, set, shop! Charlotte Tilbury launches summer sale We've all been glowing more than we'd like lately, thanks to scorching temperatures, so if you're looking to sweatproof your makeup, the Charlotte Tilbury summer sale couldn't have come at a better time. Running until July 22, the sale will include some of the brand's bestsellers, including limited edition beauty boxes and 2025 Mystery Boxes, with up to 50 per cent off. You can find the savings on the Charlotte Tilbury Easy Beauty for You app and online at CharlotteTilbury.com. Presenting: Ruggable x Mrs Alice She's been a Standard Shopping favourite since its 2019 launch, and with the new Ruggable collection, our homewares obsession for all things Mrs. Alice's style has only gotten stronger. The 12-strong collection of designs will appeal to maximalists and cottagecore fans, with a distinct English country home feel that will bring life, colour and warmth to any space. Each one is washable and stain-resistant, too, which makes post-dinner party clean-up less of a headache. Find them in a host of sizes, including runners and doormats. From ¬£119. Monsoon sale offers up to 60 per cent off Still haven't figured out what to wear to that wedding that's fast approaching in your diary? Make a beeline for Monsoon, where the summer sale is wiping up to 60 per cent off the RRP of some cute dresses, from midis to cocktail designs. There's even a kids' sale, so you can deck out your mini-me in similar finery. Oliver Bonas adds new styles to the summer sale Hundreds of freshly discounted products and fashion items have joined the sales rail at Oliver Bonas, with up to 50 per cent off the RRP. Expect cute trinkets, homewares, fashion and furniture for a satisfying dose of retail therapy. Ettinger releases luxe golf accessories Looking for a fitting gift for the golf fan in your life? Head to Ettinger, where you can find new leather golf accessories for him and her. Designed to raise your style game, the handmade accessories can be personalised for an extra special touch. The collection spans a golf tidy, accessory caddy, golf pouch, golf scorecard holder, and a golf card case. Prices from ¬£125. Naturium takes Battersea with a pop-up Should you find yourself in SW11 on July 18 - 20, be sure to stop by Malaysia Square near Battersea Power Station to pick up a skin-nourishing smoothie courtesy of Naturium. The beauty brand is rolling into the area with a 'Glow Getter' smoothie truck to deploy goodness to fans, inside and out. You'll also get to check out the new collection of the same name. Where: Malaysia Square, Battersea Power Station, SW11 8BJ When: July 18 - 20 Timings: 10am‚Äì6pm Can't make it? Find the collection and more below....

transcript: ‚Äâ In honour of their charitable work with The King's Trust, the human-rights attorney and the beauty mogul sat down with¬†Glamour's global editorial director Samantha Barry to discuss sisterhood, advocacy, and why showing up for women isn't a luxury, it's a legacy. The first time Amal Clooney met Charlotte Tilbury, the human rights lawyer was preparing for her wedding. Charlotte arrived at her front door heavily pregnant and wheeling five oversized suitcases of makeup. Amal blinked at the sheer theatricality of it. ‚ÄúIs all that for me?‚Äù she asked. For the renowned makeup artist, that was travelling light. By the time of the wedding, Charlotte was no longer just the makeup artist getting the bride ready‚Äîshe was an invited guest. Their connection, built on shared energy and strong maternal figures, became the beginning of something much more enduring: a sisterhood rooted in purpose, ambition, love, and a healthy dose of honesty. They come from different worlds (although as Charlotte points out, both are Aquarius with Pisces mothers)‚Äîone a decorated human rights lawyer, the other a global beauty entrepreneur. Amal has led landmark cases for women who went on to be Nobel laureates ‚Äì like Nadia Murad¬†and Maria Ressa. She has defended political prisoners, helped free journalists across continents, and shaped justice systems from Myanmar to The Hague. As cofounder of the Clooney Foundation for Justice with her husband, actor and director, George Clooney, she has now created a global network that provides free legal representation to thousands of women and girls around the world and helped free dozens of journalists who have been imprisoned for their speech. Charlotte has built a bona fide beauty empire valued at over $1 billion, was the first makeup artist to receive an MBE‚Äîmember of the Order of the British Empire, an honour awarded by the monarch for a particular achievement‚Äîand is a definitive staple in makeup bags for millions of people across the globe. I've known both women for years. Amal and I have been close friends since our single days in London, when I was working as a television producer for the BBC and Amal was already a phenomenal legal mind working as a barrister at law firm Doughty Street Chambers. I met Charlotte at Amal's wedding, where the sparkle on her eye shadow was rivalled only by her energy on the dance floor. Since then I've followed their work and their life paths. On a sunny June morning, I sit with both women in Amal's English country home to do more than just catch up‚Äîto discuss empowering initiatives that are dear to them both. Amal and Charlotte have just been at Buckingham Palace where they've used their friendship as a launchpad for real impact via their work with¬†The King's Trust, a charitable organisation founded by King Charles III (then Prince Charles) in 1976. It was renamed from The Prince's Trust in 2024 and focuses on providing young people who are facing challenges with mentorship, funding, job training, and skill building. Both Amal and Charlotte have spent the last four years mentoring and uplifting young women from around the world‚ÄîKenya, Pakistan, India‚Äîmany of whom are survivors of poverty, forced marriage, or systemic violence. The award created by the Trust in Amal's name honors one extraordinary young woman each year, while Charlotte hosts hands-on workshops to teach entrepreneurship and confidence. And then there are the Albie Awards, hosted by the Clooney Foundation for Justice‚Äîan annual event that shines a spotlight on the unsung heroes who are fighting for justice: journalists, advocates, and human rights defenders risking their lives for truth. transcript: ‚Äâ Amal and husband George Clooney share two children Kayla Grant Link copied Taylor Hill/WireImage Amal Clooney NEED TO KNOW During an interview with Glamour, Amal Clooney revealed how she maintains privacy in her household The activist is a mom of two children: 8-year-old twins Ella and Alexander Amal and George Clooney welcomed their twins in June 2017 Amal Clooney will do anything to maintain her family's privacy. The activist, 47, recently spoke with Glamour about her partnership with husband George Clooney, her private family life and boundary setting in a conversation with Charlotte Tilbury. Amal, who shares 8-year-old twins Ella and Alexander with the Oscar-winning actor, 64, revealed that when guests visit her home, she takes away their phones to create a safe space for private moments. "Creating private moments and spaces is becoming increasingly difficult. But that's also why we entertain a lot at home," she told the outlet. "I now have a phone basket that I use to take everyone's phones away!" "It's important to get that balance where you have time alone with your family and with your friends where people feel like you can have a safe and frank exchange," she added. "And I would say becoming a parent means you're more troubled by some of the intrusions. So we do the best we can to minimize any impact on our children. We don't put our children out there, we've never put their photo out there or anything like that." Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer‚Äã‚Äã, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Amal Clooney and George Clooney Following their Italian wedding in 2014, George and Amal welcomed their twins Alexander and Ella in June 2017. The Clooneys are very discerning about choosing work projects to ensure their kids take priority. "In marriage, and now with the kids, you give away the selfishness of only looking out for yourself," George told PEOPLE. "It's a wonderful thing. Amal and I talk about it every day. We feel so lucky." George may be an A-list celebrity, but he isn't immune to the woes of parenting. For now, the actor says he gets a little help from the jolly guy in the big red suit when his twins are misbehaving. transcript: ‚Äâ Their triumph at the 2022 Euros turned England's Lionesses from little-known footballers into national heroines. And if the tournament made them famous, it also transformed their lives off the pitch. From lucrative brand ambassadorships with high-end fashion labels such as Gucci to turns on the red carpet in dresses worthy of a Kardashian, England's female footballers now enjoy more than a touch of glitz and glamour. Once badly paid and barely recognised ‚Äì who could forget goalie Mary Earps complaining before the last Euros that Nike hadn't even bothered to print replica shirts with her name on them ‚Äì the nation's female footballers now have a soaring commercial appeal. So as they prepare to face France at 8pm tonight in their first game of this year's Euros ‚Äì and inspire a new generation of young women with their sporting prowess ‚Äì Molly Clayton reveals which of our Lionesses enjoys the most luxurious lifestyle. The Gucci model Shoots for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of ¬£1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith ‚Äì both have posted about each other on social media. Ella the business brainbox With her ever-present fake eyelashes and love of make-up, Manchester United midfielder Ella Toone, 25, often showcases her beauty routine on her own YouTube channel. And with a canny business acumen to boot, Ella has already shaped an enviable off-pitch career. The first England women's player to trademark her name, she's set up her own brand, ET7, which includes a football academy for young girls. The name is inspired by her childhood hero, Portuguese footballing superstar Cristiano Ronaldo, whose own brand is called CR7. With some estimating her worth at more than ¬£1 million, last month she set up her own creative agency, Amicizia, which aims to connect female athletes to commercial and marketing opportunities with top brands. Her sponsors include make-up company Charlotte Tilbury, orthodontic brand Invisalign and McDonald's, with her yearly earnings estimated as upwards of ¬£200,000, fuelled by her popularity on social media. At one point, she was one of the top five most viewed athletes on TikTok. Ella has 737,000 Instagram followers and her own BBC podcast with best friend and fellow Lioness Alessia Russo, with whom she has appeared on the front cover of fashion and beauty magazine Elle. Ella loves nothing more than a red carpet bash. In a relationship with footballer Joe Bunney of Stalybridge Celtic FC, she regularly treats her fans to glimpses of their lavish holidays abroad and spa days at five-star hotels. Lauren's ooh la la lego Proving that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated ¬£400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. Shy superstar with an ex on the team Growing up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne ‚Äì also known as Holy Island ‚Äì off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage ‚Äì and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home ¬£200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. Fashion week regular She earned almost ¬£2 million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than ¬£500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a ¬£1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. Revealing outfits... on pitch too! Hair scraped back and with braces on her teeth, Chloe Kelly scored that late winning goal against Germany at Wembley in 2022, famously taking off her top in celebration. Since then, she has revelled in her success with a glossy makeover....

transcript: ‚Äâ THE GUCCI MODEL SHOOTS for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of ¬£1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith - both have posted about each other on social media. LAUREN'S OOH LA LA LEGO PROVING that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated ¬£400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. SHY SUPERSTAR WITH AN EX ON THE TEAM GROWING up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne - also known as Holy Island - off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage - and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home ¬£200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. FASHION WEEK REGULAR SHE earned almost ¬£2million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than ¬£500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a ¬£1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. The 24-year-old Chelsea player has posed in Burberry for Elle magazine and counts Nike and Extra chewing gum among her corporate sponsors. She also works with Birmingham Children's Hospital after enduring numerous eye operations as a child to cure a squint. Hannah was told she would never be a professional sports player. ' I've gone through life proving people wrong,' she said recently, words that inspired devotion among her 228,000 Instagram followers. Her relationship status isn't known. DUBAI DEVOTEE SHE never travels without her Louis Vuitton luggage, can often be seen posing in a Maybach car, and enjoys swanky trips to Dubai, staying at the luxury Five resort there. Chelsea star Lauren James, 23, has treated herself to some of the finer things in life since her key role in the Lionesses' 2023 World Cup campaign. While her relationship status isn't known, she's close to her older brother Reece, who plays for the Chelsea men's team. She has commercial deals with Nike, Google Pixel, Optimum Nutrition, Sure deodorant and Walkers. The superstar siblings often attend red carpet events together. But while she is reportedly on ¬£350,000 a year at Chelsea, Reece earns ¬£250,000 a week. KOOKY STYLE SO DEVOTED is she to tattoos that midfielder Georgia Stanway, 26, not only has around 100 of her own inkings, but she's also learned to tattoo other people. The Bayern Munich star's kooky style has won her sponsors including Nike and an advertising deal with Celsius drinks, who featured on her Instagram page, where she has 433,000 followers. Off the pitch, she's been with Toulouse rugby league player Olly Ashall-Bott since 2022....

transcript: ‚Äâ The Mancunians performed another two hour set at the Principality Stadium Sienna Miller was among the celebrities in Cardiff to watch the second Oasis reunion show tonight. The A list actor hailed the show as the 'greatest' she'd ever seen. Other famous faces to watch the performance included former Doctor Who star Matt Smith, who was also at last night's gig, and makeup mogul Charlotte Tilbury. Danny Dyer, Holly Willoughby and Vernon Kay were some of the stars on show for last night's concert. When Sienna was asked by The Mirror what she thought of the concert, she joked: "It was alright," before revealing she was there for both Cardiff gigs. "It's the greatest show I've ever seen. The love and the nostalgia and the joy, it's like saving the world." Matt Smith said the show was "amazing". Oasis returned for a second night at the Principality Stadium to perform another two hour show, with the 23 song setlist unchanged from last night. The set started with Hello, the first song on 1995's (What's the Story) Morning Glory, and again ended with Champagne Supernova. The Gallagher brothers again strode onto the stage, arm in arm, as they did on Friday night. Liam then bowed down before his brother, as seen on fan footage of the gig. Like the first night, Liam enjoyed some banter with the crowd. After Bring It On Down, he asked the crowd to 'do the Poznan', the celebration which Manchester City fans took from Polish side Lech Poznan, where supporters turn their back to the game and jump up and down, arm in arm. Noel also got involved. Before beginning Half The World Away, he joked: "This is for the Royale Family!" During the final bars of Whatever, Liam changed the words and sang a few lines from The Beatles' Octopus's Garden. During Don't Look Back in Anger, tributes were again paid to victims of the Manchester Arena attack, with images of bees appearing on the big screen. Ending with Champagne Supernova, the band played the same setlist as the opening show of the tour. The brothers from Burnage were again joined on stage by guitarist Paul 'Bonehead' Arthurs, who is back with both Gallaghers for the first time in 25 years after leaving the group in 1999. The founding members were joined by long-time members Andy Bell, previously of shoegaze icons Ride, and guitarist Gem Archer, who replaced Bonehead. Completing the line up is new drummer Joey Waronker, who recently performed on Liam Gallagher and John Squire's recent album. Touring members also include Christian Madden on keyboards, Jessica Greenfield on backing vocals, Alastair White on trombone, Steve Hamilton on saxophone and Joe Auckland on trumpet. Next up for the band is a five night residency at Heaton Park, with gigs on Friday, July 11, Saturday, July 12, Wednesday, July 16, Saturday, July 19 and Sunday, July 20.

Good luck!

transcript: ‚Äâ Make just a few of these hair, fragrance, makeup, and skincare swaps, and you'll start to save $$. 1. CeraVe's Retinol Serum,¬†which lives up to the CeraVe name and uses *encapsulated* retinol to reduce the appearance of scars and pores without flaking or redness. If you haven't gotten into retinoids yet or are worried about irritating your skin, this gentle but effective serum is a great option ‚Äî and reviewers say they like it better than other more expensive options (like Murad's Retinol Serum, which retails for $92). And remember, like with any retinol (that actually works) *just do not use it every day. * Start slow and work yourself up if needed, paying attention to your skin. Promising review: "I absolutely love this stuff! I saw a dermatologist on¬†TikTok¬†who raved about this product and tried it out, and it's been the most amazing stuff! It's helped my face to clear up very quickly removing all of the blemish spots and dark spots around my face. It's been one of the best products I've added to my face routine. This would be great for all ages/stages and for any weather types. It doesn't moisturize much, but that's not it's intention, and there is no scent, so I'd imagine it's great for all skin types and hypoallergenic." ‚ÄîSuccessful Solo Promising review: "I bought this for my teenager to use for his acne scars, but he ended up not using it. I ran out of my Murad retinol serum, so I gave this a try. I actually like it¬†better¬†than¬†the Murad! It absorbs quickly, with zero smell or irritation. As with any retinol product, be sure to wear sunscreen when you're going to be outside." ‚ÄîC. Munsterman Get it from Amazon for¬†$18.68. 2. E.l.f. Halo Glow Liquid Filter¬†that reviewers say is comparable to (or even better than) Charlotte Tilbury's famous Flawless Filter. Apply this as a luminous, blurring base, mix it with your moisturizer or foundation, or dot it over makeup as a natural-looking highlight. It's formulated with hyaluronic acid and squalene for a boost of hydration too! Promising review: "This stuff is so legit I've gone through three bottles. Adds the perfect glow to your skin! Sometimes I use it under foundation, and sometimes, I use it solo with a bit of concealer. I will never not repurchase it for the price and how beautifully it sits on the skin. This stuff is viral for a reason!!" ‚Äîmapagill Promising review: "If you like Charlotte Tilbury Flawless Filter, this is leaps and bounds¬†better! Just buy it. The coverage is¬†better and makes my skin have the most amazing natural glow! The colors run with a more warm/yellow undertone, which worked great for me! Spend a fraction of the price and just get it; you will be happy you did!" ‚ÄîAmazonreview Get it from Amazon for $14 (available in 12 shades). 3. And their¬†Halo Glow Beauty Wand, a buildable liquid highlighter formula that delivers a majorly radiant, lit-from-within finish to your skin without lots of glitter (like Charlotte Tilbury's highlighter blush wands). The cushion-tip applicator is super easy to apply, too! One reviewer says it's an alternative to the Charlotte Tilbury highlighters! Promising review: "We saw this highlighter in a makeup tutorial video online and thought we would try it. It was an easy decision to purchase it because the price was relatively low compared to other highlighters. It is worth every penny and more! I've seen this shade applied on different skin tones and it looks beautiful on everyone! Just the right shimmer, not glitter. It's gorgeous!" ‚ÄîJoyinmyheart Get it from Amazon for $9 (available in three shades). E.l.f. also has reviewer-loved glowy blush and contour shades in the same wand design!...

transcript: ‚Äâ SPR_COMBO[de]Eines der gr√∂√üten Sch√∂nheitsunternehmen der Welt ist Berichten zufolge einen Verkauf von sich selbst. Anfang Juni berichtete WWD, dass Coty erw√§gt, seine Verbraucher- und Prestige-Divisionen zu ver√§u√üern, darunter einige der bekanntesten Marken von Beauty wie Covergirl sowie Chlo√©- und Hugo-Chef-Parfums. Die Ank√ºndigung versetzte den Aktienkurs von Coty 13 Prozent auf 5 USD; Die Ver√§u√üerung beider Waffen w√ºrde im Wesentlichen mehr als 120 Jahre als Unternehmen beendet. Coty lehnte es ab, sich zu dem Bericht zu √§u√üern. Trotz seiner Gr√∂√üe und Stall bekannter Namen hat das amerikanische Konglomerat in den letzten Jahren Schwierigkeiten, mit seinen Konkurrenten Schritt zu halten. Innerhalb des Portfolios seines gr√∂√üten Anteilseigners Jab Holdings ist Coty das schlechteste Kapital und senkt den Ausblick im letzten Gesch√§ftsjahr, wobei weitere Umsatzr√ºckg√§nge projiziert werden. Coty hat versucht, sein Ansehen zu verbessern. Seit seinem derzeitigen CEO Sue Nabi im Jahr 2020 eintraf, hat das Unternehmen das Fett getrimmt und nicht-Kernmarken wie Professional Lines Wella und OPI abgebrochen. Aber es bleibt immer noch seine √§u√üeren Kollegen wie L'Or√©al und Elf Beauty zur√ºck, und im Mai verkaufte es Skkn von Kim, der Prestige-Hautpflegemarke, an seinen Gr√ºnder zur√ºck, den Multi-Hyphenate-Reality-Star Kim Kardashian und ihre Bekleidungsfirma Skims, nachdem die Marke vers√§umt hatte, mit Schaufenster f√ºr Furore zu machen. Die Kerngesch√§fte, Duft- und Drogerie -Make -up, stehen ebenfalls unter Druck. W√§hrend der Duft die kategorische Kategorie der Branche ist und Coty einige der weltweit bekanntesten D√ºfte der Welt herstellt, ist der heftig wettbewerbsf√§hige Sektor mit neuen Herausforderern gef√ºllt. Die Bem√ºhungen, das Summen wie trendige K√∂rpermists f√ºr Calvin Klein und die Wiederbelebung von Marc Jacobs Beauty zu f√∂rdern, sind in einem von Nischenspieler und Tiktok -Viralit√§t dominierten Markt ein R√ºckgang des Ozeans. Die Drogerie -Marken haben ebenfalls unterdurchschnittlich geschafft. ‚ÄúSo ziemlich alles in der Messe hat nicht funktioniert ‚Ä¶ Ich gebe ihnen viel Anerkennung daf√ºr, dass sie kreativ sind und Dinge ausprobieren‚Äù, sagte Lauren Lieberman, Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrer bei Barclays Consumer Practice, in der Bem√ºhungen zur Wiederbelebung von Covergirl. Sie bemerkte auch die ged√§mpfte Wiederbelebung der Philosophie, die Hautpflege und die Bade- und K√∂rperlinie, die ein gro√üer Erfolg in den Aughts sowie die Sun Care Line Lancaster war. Mit dem R√ºcktritt von Jab Holdings 'langj√§hriger Vorsitzender Peter Harb im April wird neue F√ºhrung wahrscheinlich f√ºr ein neues Denken bereit sein. Wenn Coty versucht, K√§ufer von Gerichts zu nehmen, sind potenzielle Bieter schlank und w√ºrden wahrscheinlich in einige ausgew√§hlte Kategorien fallen. bricht zusammen, wer interessiert sein k√∂nnte ‚Äì und warum ‚Äì unten. Die Kronjuwelen Prestige -Duft bleibt Cotys hei√üeste Eigenschaft. Es enth√§lt langfristige Lizenzen f√ºr Chlo√©, Gucci, Hugo-Chef und Calvin Klein, einige der ber√ºhmtesten Modeh√§user der Welt. Hugo -Chef wird als die gr√∂√üte Marke des Unternehmens angesehen, die rund 10 Prozent oder rund 585 Millionen US -Dollar in H√∂he von rund 9 Prozent und 7 Prozent des Gesamtumsatzes des Unternehmens umfasst. Dies sind w√ºnschenswerte Verm√∂genswerte, selbst mit intensiver Konkurrenz durch Inseln auf dem Weg. Diese D√ºfte des Modehaus sind weit verbreitet, bekannt und haben ein integriertes Prestige und Dynamik. Ein Spezialist f√ºr Duftlizenzspezialist wie Interphlum, das f√ºr Lacoste und Anna Sui Parfums herstellt, k√∂nnte theoretisch interessiert sein. Seit 2022 hat es DKNY wiederbelebt und die Linie neu anspricht, nachdem LVMH sie an die G-III-Gruppe, ein Modeportfoliounternehmen, abgeladen hatte. Das spanische Konglomerat Puig k√∂nnte auch ein Anw√§rter sein; W√§hrend es sein Vertrauen in die Lizenzierung verringert hat und sich stattdessen auf den Besitz von Marken ver√§ndert hat, nachdem sie Byredo und Charlotte Tilbury aufgenommen haben, verwaltet es geschickt √§hnliche Modehaus-Duftmarken wie Carolina Herrera und Jean-Paul Gaultier und k√∂nnte dazu beitragen, dass die Marken frische Energie injizieren k√∂nnten. Mode -Lizenzunternehmen wie Tapestry, PVH Corp oder Capri k√∂nnten auch daran interessiert sein, ihre Best√§nde zu diversifizieren und dem Mix Sch√∂nheit zu verleihen, insbesondere f√ºr bew√§hrte Linien wie Burberry und Calvin Klein, von denen letztere das Modegesch√§ft besitzt. Der Luxusmarken ' Mutterunternehmen m√∂chten m√∂glicherweise auch ihre Sch√∂nheitsangebote wieder in Haus bringen. Der Gucci-Besitzer Kering hat kein Geheimnis aus seinen lauwartigen Gef√ºhlen gegen√ºber der Gucci-Sch√∂nheitsmarke unter Cotys Besitz, die 2028 abl√§uft, kein Geheimnis gemacht, und Kering hat jetzt eine interne Sch√∂nheitsabteilung mit Creed. LVMH, dem Marc Jacobs geh√∂rt, hat sich als Expertise in Beauty bew√§hrt und Sch√∂nheitsangebote wie Dior und Guerlain verwaltet. ‚ÄûDie Tatsache, dass Coty gedauert hat [as a company] So lange ist, weil Duft ein so gro√üartiges Gesch√§ft ist ‚Äú, sagte Lieberman. In j√ºngerer Zeit beginnen Unternehmen wie LVMH und KERING ihre eigenen Sch√∂nheitswaffen oder konsolidieren ihre Bem√ºhungen auf andere Weise. Lieberman sagte, andere Firmen wie Puig oder Fashion Lizenzierh√§user k√∂nnten alle logische Bieter sein, aber das Reiben ist, dass Cotys F√§higkeit, diese Lizenzen zu verkaufen, nicht eindeutig ist. Abh√§ngig von der Art der unterzeichneten urspr√ºnglichen Vereinbarungen k√∂nnen sie m√∂glicherweise das Eigentum an ein neues Unternehmen √ºbertragen. transcript: ‚Äâ ‚Äì Spice strategy. The best journalism often comes from topics that writers are personally passionate about‚Äîan obsession they have, or a question they can't stop thinking about. That's what happened for my colleague Jessica Mathews and her new Fortune story about Diaspora Co. The 8-year-old startup now pulling in ‚Äúmid-millions‚Äù per year sells high-quality spices sourced from 140 farms. Founder Sana Javeri Kadri started with turmeric, after noting its growing popularity in the U.S., and has expanded to black pepper, cardamom, spice blends, and more. Among foodies and those who care about high-quality ingredients, the brand is incredibly popular. Jessica reached out to Javeri Kadri because she wanted to know, essentially, why and how her spices taste so good. The founder told her that most spices are indigenous to South Asia, and taste different when grown there‚Äîeven compared to the same seeds, extracted and planted elsewhere. Diaspora Co. was bootstrapped for five years, before Javeri Kadri raised a $1 million pre-seed round and then a 2024 $1.5 million seed round from a whopping 75 angel investors, from Meena Harris to the founder of Salt & Straw ice cream‚Äîa strategy that helped her set aside 35% of the company's equity for farmers and employees. ‚ÄúWith the grocery venture capital world right now, you're often selling an unprofitable product at scale and hoping that it'll eventually become profitable,‚Äù she told Jessica. ‚ÄúI can't do that for my farm partners‚Äîthat's a very short-term outlook. I want their kids to inherit their family business, and the family business to be thriving. I want our farmers to be happy,‚Äù she says. Read the full story here. Emma Hinchliffe emma.hinchliffe@fortune.com The Most Powerful Women Daily newsletter is Fortune's daily briefing for and about the women leading the business world. Today's edition was curated by Sara Braun. Subscribe here. ALSO IN THE HEADLINES -BBB. President Trump signed his domestic spending bill into law in a Fourth of July ceremony, after the House narrowly passed the bill with a 218-214 vote on Thursday afternoon. Two Republican members joined the House Democrats in opposing the bill. The legislation will increase spending on immigration enforcement while making cuts to Medicaid, SNAP, and clean energy funding. CBS News -¬†Tragedy in Texas. Ten girls and one counselor are currently missing from Camp Mystic, a storied Christian girls' summer camp in Texas, amid severe flooding. The storms have ravaged central Texas and have killed at least 79 people. New York Times -¬†Suriname election. The parliament of Suriname backed Jennifer Simons as the country's first woman president. Simons leads the country's National Democratic Party, which beat out President Chan Santokhi's incumbent party in the most recent general election. Her inauguration is set for July 16. Reuters - A potential trans ban. The U.S. Supreme Court has agreed to take up two cases regarding a ban on transgender women and girls from competing on their school's female athletic teams. Idaho and West Virginia are currently appealing lower-court rulings that block their bans from taking place. Arguments for the case will likely take place in the fall, with a decision expected by June 2026. Politico MOVERS AND SHAKERS Vistra, an operational and administrative business platform, appointed Kim Jenkins as CEO. She previously served as the COO of the company. Parity, a platform for professional women athlete partnerships, announced the appointment of Dr. Risa Isard as director of research and insights. She most recently served as a professor of sports management at the University of Connecticut. ON MY RADAR Korean internet giant Kakao teams with OpenAI to jumpstart growth Forbes Essence Fest leads a summer of events for Black entrepreneurs galvanized by economic uncertainty CNBC The non-exoneration of Diddy The Atlantic PARTING WORDS ‚ÄúShow up as your authentic self.‚Äù...

transcript: ‚Äâ You won't believe what you can nab on Prime Day if you know where to look.Don't miss out on these secretly fabulous items at Amazon during Prime Day sales. Like many, I take advantage of Amazon Prime Day sales to stock up on the everyday things I use most in life, like contact solution, makeup remover, cleaning products and more. However, it's also the perfect time to shop some of Amazon's best-kept secrets, including products that you just didn't know you could get on Amazon, like luxury beauty products, Away suitcases and even a trendy (yet still effective) hand sanitizer brand. Because I would never gatekeep, I've rounded up quite the assortment of HuffPost's secret top-sellers and clandestine staff faves that are currently majorly discounted for Prime Day. Keep reading and pick up one of these secretly must-have items and enjoy serious deals while they are still hot. Prices change quickly on Prime Day, so keep checking back to see the latest updates. Make sure to sign up for an Amazon Prime account to get the best deals. Touchland Power Mist hydrating hand sanitizer spray trio (30% off list price) Whether you're traveling this summer or simply moving through life, there are plenty of places that we frequent that can get pretty germy, making hand sanitizer a daily essential. The Touchland Power Mist Hydrating hand sanitizer is a great option that not only contains 70% alcohol to kill germs but is infused with nourishing skin care ingredients like aloe vera and lemon essential oil to keep your skin from drying out. L'Or√©al Lumi Glotion (41% off list price) We've formally called L'Oreal's Lumi Glotion the perfect shortcut to perfect skin and one of the most convincing alternatives to the famed Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter. Available in five flexible shades, this tinted moisturizer is famous for offering sheer yet luminous coverage and promises to melt seamlessly into skin without setting into fine lines or appearing cakey. Wear it alone, under makeup or as a highlighter and enjoy the formula infusion of long-adored ingredients such as shea butter and glycerin, a humectant that draws moisture into the skin for all-day hydration. Medicube Zero Pore pads (52% off list price) Few items have impressed me as much as these cult-favorite toning facial pads. I've ditched my traditional AHA serums for these bad boys, and my skin has never looked better. The Medicube pads are designed to help exfoliate, balance and brighten skin while reducing oil production, minimizing breakouts and refining the look of pores. They are formulated with powerful alpha and beta hydroxy acids like white willow bark, vitamin C and calming botanical extracts like lavender to soothe skin. I've noticed that my skin is softer, smoother and has a really noticeable glow. Most importantly, I've detected a decrease in melasma, which has plagued me since my pregnancy. They're incredibly potent, and it's very obvious to me why they're so popular. I've tried out other exfoliating pads and can confidently say that these are just as, if not more, effective at a fraction of the price. They've been a game-changer for my skin in the last couple of months, and I just hope they don't sell out now that the secret's out! A multifunctional electric spin scrubber brush (38% off list price) There's a good chance you've spotted bathroom spin scrubber brushes on social media, but this is the first time we've eyed a multi-use brush that can be used everywhere from the bathroom to the kitchen (although for sanitary reasons, we recommend you grab two for separate use in those rooms), on dishes and beyond. It includes a kitchen spin scrubber, a small flat brush, a sisal brush, two scouring pad brushes, two sponge brushes, two descaling brushes and a velcro adaptor for pads. This little guy will leave no grime left behind! A wireless CarPlay adapter (50% off list price) With this one tiny gadget, you'll have the power to seamlessly connect your phone to your vehicle's CarPlay system so that every function you enjoy on your phone ‚Äî calls, voice commands, maps, music and more ‚Äî can be accessible without needing to manually plug in. This even extends to the physical controls on your steering wheel. Please note that this lightning-fast adapter is only compatible with iPhones 10 and above. A similar model is often popping up on TikTok, but this one is our special secret. It's especially good for anyone proudly pushing an older vehicle that doesn't have Bluetooth capabilities. Clinique Almost Lipstick tinted lip balm (30% off list price) Many beauty lovers know that this perfectly hued beauty product is the end-all be-all of lip balms. It's available in Black Honey and Pink Honey shades, though Black Honey is a cult-favorite lip color that's considered universally flattering and has been popular since the early aughts. This semi-glossy balm is perfect for everyday wear and many a beauty insider's secret weapon. I honestly can't believe it's available as an Amazon Prime Day deal! Away Bigger carry-on luggage (20% off list price) The Bigger carry-on is what put Away on the map. It fits an astonishing amount of clothing while still complying with carry-on regulations for most major airlines. It's a game-changer for people who never want to check a bag. Like all of Away's suitcases, it's made with durable, water-repellent and lightweight materials and 360-degree wheels that glide with ease. The adjustable trolley handle has two height settings, while the interior compression pad system and organizer makes it easy to load up on clothing. It also comes with a water-repellent laundry bag and is available in seven colors. Away bags only landed on Amazon a of couple of months ago, and no one was expecting them to be included during Prime Day sales. A pair of silky pajamas (28% off list price) Parsing through the myriad of clothing deals during Prime Day is a bit of a chore, and the really good stuff easily gets lost in the shuffle, like this lightweight set. It is soft, breathable and feels silky smooth against the skin....

transcript: ‚Äâ As a beauty writer I'm always on the look-out for new products to add to my arsenal so while on a recent holiday to Portugal I had to know what self-tan my friend was using to achieve her gorgeous glow. The item in question turned out to be the Isle of Paradise Self-Tanning Body Drops, which come in three shades - light, medium and dark. Founded by celebrity tanning expert Jules Von Hep, several A-listers have been rumoured to use products from Isle of Paradise including Margot Robbie who was reportedly tanned using the medium self-tanning water for the Barbie Tour. The self-tanning drops would typically retail for ¬£24.95, however, an Amazon Prime Day deal sees them reduced to ¬£17.89. The Amazon offer beats the price shoppers will currently find them at Boots, Sephora and Cult Beauty. To take advantage of the Amazon deal, consumers must be a member of Prime and they can sign up for a free 30-day trial here. READ MORE: Amazon's ¬£28 maxi dress 'hugs every contour' and 'feels just like' Kim Kardashian's brand READ MORE: Fragrance fans snap up ¬£36 Sol de Janeiro tote bag set that's worth ¬£52 Isle of Paradise's self-tanning drops are completely customisable so the user can add as many drops as they wish into their usual body moisturiser. It's a much easier way to tan the body, ensuring less risk of streaks and patchy tan. The formula is also boosted with caffeine, baobab and oat extract to help make the skin appear firmer, brighter and smoother. Shoppers say 'this is the first fake tan I've used where someone has asked me if I'd been on holiday so I'm pretty pleased with it', making it an ideal choice for the summer season. Another loyal customer wrote: "On my third consecutive bottle. 8 drops gives a healthy skin glow. Looks great under makeup. Nice consistency, dries well and is not patchy as it comes off." Amazon Prime Sign Up Amazon Prime membership, including exclusive Prime Day discounts and perks on Hello Fresh, music, books and Prime Video. Usually ¬£8.99 a month, you can now get a 30-day free trial to get access to the latest deals. Free Amazon It has been noted by a few users the drops should be 'used sparingly' and one customer gave a warning, writing: "Beware though, you do need to wash your hands thoroughly after use though otherwise you will be left with brown tide marks on your skin. I would recommend starting off gradually and then adding more as needed." Other popular self-tanning drops include the Charlotte Tilbury Beautiful Skin Island Glow Easy Tanning Drops. They are ¬£38 at Space NK and reviews say 'these are the most flawless tanning drop I've ever used'. However, they only come in two shades, compared the Isle of Paradise's three. Another option that is said to 'hydrate as it glows' are from Pai. The Impossible Tan Hydrating Self Tan Drops retail for ¬£34 at LookFantastic and shoppers say they 'create a lovely natural healthy looking tan'. Customers of Isle of Paradise share before and after results (Image: Amazon) But, the most affordable option out of the above are the Isle of Paradise drops, part of the Amazon Prime Day sale. A happy customer wrote: "I love this product - I was introduced to it in a gift set and this is me replenishing what I've already used! A couple of drops in my normal moisturiser and I have a natural glow! I keep getting comments on how well I look." Someone else raved about how it extended their existing tan, writing: "I bought these drops to carry on my glow from holiday. I am very fair skinned and even after two weeks in the Maldives I was barely tanned! These little drops were great for adding to that, I used two-three drops in with my nighttime moisturiser two or three times a week, that's all I needed and I got compliments from the first use. I think I looked more glowing from these than the holiday." And a third commented: "I love this. I first tried a sample of this and fell in love. This product lets you control the tan, I tend to go for 4 drops for a natural looking tan. I just drop the tan into my moisturiser and apply it as normal. It takes about 2-4hrs to develop."

transcript: ‚Äâ Amazon's Prime Day Sale is here with offers on home, electronics, beauty and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette 30ml is one of the most sought-after fragrances on the online giant's platform - now reduced from ¬£42 to ¬£11.97. Prime members can access the vast majority of the exclusive deals and while a membership costs around ¬£8.99 per month, Amazon is letting shoppers try it free for 30 days. It gets users benefits like unlimited one-day and same-day delivery, Prime Videos, ad-free Prime Music and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette is Amazon's number one best-seller in the perfume category and with an overwhelming 54,550 global ratings, the fragrance boasts an exquisite blend with top notes of apple and water lily, a heart featuring pink guava and dark chocolate, and a sumptuous base of amber and vanilla. The lovely heart-shaped bottle also features a regal-looking golden bottle cap with amethyst-coloured crystals. Shoppers can also get the same perfume at Boots, which is currently selling¬† a 100ml bottle for ¬£26,where it's available for next-day delivery with code FREENEXTDAY. Meanwhile, Charlotte Tilbury is offering its "mood-boosting" Love Frequency Perfume Set for ¬£91 instead of ¬£130 - a saving of 30%. Shoppers can get their hands on the brand's woody floral fragrance in both 100ml and 10ml bottles. The light and floral scent has been described as "perfect for daytime" while some loyal fans have called it their "all time favourite", reports Liverpool Echo. One shopper noted: "What sets Vera Wang Princess apart is its versatility. It seamlessly transitions from day to night, making it suitable for various occasions. Whether you're attending a casual outing or a formal event, this fragrance complements any ensemble and leaves a trail of elegance and charm in your wake." A delighted customer shared their experience: "My wife loves this. It smells beautiful, not too strong but the smell lingers for hours/days. A very sweet floral smell, I guarantee everyone will compliment." Another shopper wrote: "Bought this multiple times as my partner can't get enough of it over more expensive perfumes I've bought her. The bottle size is also great." A third customer expressed their newfound adoration for the fragrance, stating: "First time trying this perfume and I love it that much that I bought another one, got big size bottles and well worth it. It's my new favourite scent." Yet, not all feedback was glowing; one customer lamented the perfume's longevity: "Beautiful scent but doesn't last at all, I have to add more on several times during the day. Smells lovely and fresh though." Another shopper was left wanting more from the fragrance's intensity: "Its a nice perfume but the smell is a bit faint, it's a bit too subtle and doesn't last very long. Really need to sniff to figure out the notes." But a satisfied shopper enthused: "It's versatile for any occasion and leaves a lasting impression. A true masterpiece." For those interested in purchasing, Vera Wang's Princess Eau De Toilette is on sale at Amazon. In other deals, LookFantastic is offering a 50% discount on Versace's Woman Eau de Parfum 50ml, now ¬£33 down from ¬£66. Additionally, Boots has launched a significant fragrance sale, with some perfumes reduced to half price. READ NEXT

transcript: ‚Äâ Shoppers battling with fine or thinning hair are flocking to buy a budget-friendly haircare range that promises to add 200% more thickness after one use, compared to standard shampoo. The John Frieda PROfiller+ Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner set has left users impressed, due to its ability to quickly add volume and thickness to their locks. And now the duo has 33% off for Amazon Prime Day, dropping from ¬£24.99 to ¬£16.74. For those who aren't yet a Prime member, Amazon is offering a free 30-day trial that lets shoppers enjoy all of subscription's perks, including unlimited one-day and next-day deliveries. The John Frieda PROfiller+ range is expertly formulated with biotin and hyaluronic acid to encourage hair growth while plumping hair follicles with hydration to reduce hair loss due to breakage. The formula is silicone-free and vegan friendly and it's easy to use - apply shampoo to wet hair, lather and massage into the scalp, rinse thoroughly. For conditioning, apply the thickening conditioner to the hair, leave in for a few minutes, then rinse out. Shoppers have reported 'noticeable' results, with many asserting their hair is fuller, thicker and easier to manage. One said: "I've been suffering from hair loss for the last three years, to the point where I was considering buying a wig...my hair is 75% thinner than it was several years ago. I used this shampoo and conditioner yesterday and I immediately noticed a difference, my hair is definitely thicker. Even after one use my hair looks really good, after drying and styling it's soft, shiny and has a lot more volume." Another commented: "I am of an age now where my hair is thinning out but after I've washed my hair and conditioned it with these products, it looks so much fuller and shiny. Being able to get it in the larger packs is great because it saved a little bit of money." "This is the best my hair has felt in years. I normally have to wash my hair every day but not with this combo. Works for me," a third added but a fourth left a remark regarding the scent: "This duo is perfect for creating volume to thin hair however it leaves a weird fishy odour to your hair after use." Other than John Frieda, Philip Kingsley's Density Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner Duo is also proven to improve the health, condition and quality of fine, fragile, and shedding hair. Shoppers can enjoy 12% off and get the set at ¬£54.56. Champo's Pitta Volumising Collection is also formulated to strengthen strands, enhancing volume, shine and manageability and the shampoo and conditioner set retails at ¬£38. One five-star shopper left a suggestion in improving the bottle design: "There is one niggle I have that really does surprise me with the 500ml bottles, they should come with pumps. I have looked at other John Frieda 500ml bottles that come with pumps so why not the new 500ml bottles." Another, however, said he wouldn't recommend purchasing it and explained: "Whilst this creates some volume it leaves the hair very coarse and straw-like in texture, which had led to breakage when brushing. I wish I'd spent a bit more on a professional brand. Wouldn't recommend it." A second also agreed on the post-shampoo "coarse" hair and added: "I've applied a lot of Argan oil to try and soften and untangle it." But a satisfied customer said: "My hair has much more body and looks so much better. I also use the thickening spray which is great." The John Frieda PROfiller+ Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner bundle is available on Amazon for ¬£16.74, or shoppers can buy each product separately at Boots for ¬£9.33 each. transcript: ‚Äâ ‚ú® So pleased we finally get to announce this dreamy collab for this years creative graduates or anyone who is entry level into the creative industry. I'm teaming up with Acrylicize as part of their 'Creators in Bloom' series to bring you, 'First Impressions' which will be an evening dedicated to portfolio feedback and socialising. Join us for an exclusive session of portfolio feedback and insight from industry leaders who head up some of the most dynamic creative teams in the business, you'll receieve 'speed critiques' from CD's from Bulletproof, DixonBaxi, VCCP, Modern Citizens, Interbrand, Amazon, OVO, , forpeople, the LEGO Group, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty, The School, ITV, Apple, The School of Life, 160over90, The Romans, Waitrose & Partners to name a few. . Designed for emerging talent, this event offers a rare opportunity to hear directly from those who make the hiring decisions. Discover what truly stands out in a portfolio, what to avoid, and how to craft a body of work that captures attention and gets you hired. Whether you're preparing to enter the job market or looking to refine your portfolio, this session is packed with practical advice, honest critique, and insider tips to help you take the next step in your creative career. Plus, you'll get the chance to hear from a stellar line up of guest speakers; Ren Cavan, Matthew Jones Jones & Acrylicize's own James Burke. As well as 15+ other creative directors signed up to review your portfolios. GUEST SPEAKERS ‚≠ê Ren Cavan (they/them) is an award-winning creative director, writer and speaker with 15+ years' in brand, music, entertainment, sports (incl. esports), culture, luxe, lifestyle and innovation. They have led 360 campaigns, concepts, teams and events for brands including; Nike, Twitch, Netflix, Red Bull, Arsenal FC, Google, Spotify and Amex, to name a few. They have also been listed as Forbes 30 Under 30 in Media & Marketing and shortlisted in the DIVA Awards. As well as judging the D&AD New Blood Awards or on stage at SXSW Festival with Google. ‚≠ê James Burke's (he/him) work draws from everyday interactions and spans various mediums, exploring themes like spirituality, consumerism, and social media, while seeking authenticity in modern life. A graduate of Manchester Metropolitan University and founder of Acrylicize, his art has been showcased at prestigious venues such as the Royal Academy of Arts and Miami Art Basel. ‚≠ê Matthew Jones (he/him) is a Creative Director at THIRD HORIZON Studios. With over two decades of industry experience his career has taken him from a junior designer at Spin to being a partner at Accept & Proceed. He's now leading out a new model of studio suited to today's shifting landscape. Working across sports, fashion, tech, data, with global brands including Nike, IBM, the Design Museum and NASA. He has led teams to multiple D&AD awards and Dezeens' Designer of the Year.
